intro: Lepeostegeres gemmiflorus, commonly known as the gemmiflorous orchid, is a flowering plant belonging to the Orchidaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, particularly Indonesia and the Philippines. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and produces small, fragrant flowers in shades of white and yellow. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by enthusiasts.
